title: Ed Sheeran breaks one of footballâ€™s golden rules
text:
Paper Talk: Ipswich fan Sheeran sits in Norwich fansâ€™ section, Yakubu bottoms out, Manciniâ€™s dancing Staff writers, FOX SPORTS February 27, 2017 1:49pm 
HOW Ed Sheeran broke one of footballâ€™s golden rules, Yakubuâ€™s embarrassing outing, Harry Kaneâ€™s struggle to earn his hat-trick ball, and the real reason Roberto Mancini canâ€™t entertain the Leicester job. 
Itâ€™s all in Monday Paper Talk! 
IPSWICH FAN ED SHEERAN SITS IN NORWICH FANSâ€™ SECTION 
Everyone makes mistakes - even international superstar musician Ed Sheeran. 
The 26-year-old was spotted at one of Englandâ€™s fiercest derbies - Norwich v Ipswich - but in the process broke one of footballâ€™s biggest assumed rules. 
A Sky Sports cameraman spotted Sheeran before the commentator confirmed Sheeran was an Ipswich fan. 
The problem was that he was sitting in a Norwich home fansâ€™ section. Thatâ€™s not a popular move at any football match, let alone El Tractico where both teams were desperate to win. 
In the end the game ended in a 1-1 draw, but by the look of some Twitter reaction, peoplesâ€™ love for Sheeran transcends his indiscretion. Maybe he wonâ€™t need to trek up to that â€œCastle on the Hillâ€ after all. â€” Luca Liberti (@LucaLibz) February 26, 2017 ED SHEERAN ğŸ’™ğŸ’™ğŸ’™ of course he's an Ipswich fan ğŸšœğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ â€” Natasha Mann (@TashaItfc91) February 26, 2017 Typical, you finally get a chance to get a selfie with two NCFC legends, and an Ipswich fan photo bombs you... @adamdrury78 @Grantholt31 pic.twitter.com/pY3aRdhaJ0 â€” Andy Cossey (@AndyCossey) February 26, 2017 
SPEAKING OF MISTAKES IN THE CHAMPIONSHIP... 
How about this blunder regarding Massimo Luongoâ€™s Queens Park Rangers. 
Their Championship opponents Preston North End accidentally printed a Birmingham crest on the teamsheet where QPRâ€™s should have been. 
However, it didnâ€™t infuriate the Soccerooâ€™s team enough as they went on to lose 2-1. â€” Ian Taylor ğŸ“²ğŸ™âš½ï¸ (@IJTaylor81) February 25, 2017 @IJTaylor81 So why have PNE given QPR the Birmingham crest? â€” Lager Lout (@lagerlout1966) February 25, 2017 
BUT NOT AS EMBARRASSING AS YAKUBU 
Sure, the 34-year-old former Everton striker is now playing for Coventry in League One, but that doesnâ€™t mean he has an excuse for doing absolutely nothing. 
During the 3-1 loss to Swindon Town, he was videoed for a full two and half minutes by a fan during the match doing exactly that. Here's Yakubu not doing anything for 2 & 1/2 mins. He was the closest outfield player to Burge (our GK) during a City attack in this period pic.twitter.com/XxgoIiiRD8 â€” CJ Joiner (@CJ_covblaze) February 25, 2017 
WORLDâ€™S OLDEST PRO FOOTBALLER 
Yakubu is still in his 30s so he has no excuse when you consider Kazuyoshi Miuraâ€™s effort. 
He celebrated his 50th birthday by starting a J-League game for Yokohama FC and playing 65 minutes in the 1-0 home win over second division rival Matsumoto Yamaga. 
Heâ€™s the oldest Japanese played to partake in a professional football match and reportedly the worldâ€™s oldest pro player. 
He was given a standing ovation from 13,000 fans when he was substituted and appeared in a pink suit for his post-match press conference where he was given a bunch of red roses and a birthday cake. 
But Miuraâ€™s, whoâ€™s nickname is â€œKing Kazuâ€, career is far from over. He recently resigned with Yokohama on a one-year deal that will see him play a 32nd season and extend his own record. Japanese legend Kazuyoshi Miura played on his 50th birthday yesterday ğŸ‘ pic.twitter.com/reHswO9BfK â€” UNILAD Football (@UNILADFooty) February 27, 2017 
REFEREEâ€™S TEASE HARRY KANE 
I wonder if â€œKing Kazuâ€ has ever had this problem. 
After Harry Kane became the first Tottenham player to ever score four Premier League hat-tricks, naturally he wanted to take the match-ball home. 
However, when the striker approached referee Jon Moss to accept the it, Moss hid it away from him and the official to his left said the third goal needed to go to the, â€œdubious goals panel!â€ 
Thatâ€™s because Kane completed his treble with a free kick that took a heavy deflection off Peter Crouch. 
But the Englishman was not leaving without the ball! Refs tease 'dubious' Kane 0:29 
EPL: The officials have some fun with Harry Kane following his hattrick performance against Stoke. February 27th 2017
